channel.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
channel.description:
I really need help... Ive tried everything and am unable to figure it out lol. I continue to get errors in compiler. How do you spawn an Npc of your choice when you click on a certain object?
Thanks, Basak

item.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

This is worthless… I get what your saying and all but I not gunna get it… I learn by demonstration… but nvm, thanks anyway

This might clear a few things up

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html

Read full topic

item.source: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?

item.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

obviously what it says, package server does not exist. I have no idea what a package server even means… Probable I need to create the npc spawn in a folder so that when I state this in the code, it can go to my Npc spawn info and get the information it needs. I Dont know where to add this to though…

No.

Packages are a way to group similar objects into a logical manner. (see http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/package/packages.html )

The error is that you’re the compiler believes that Server is a package, when in actuality, it’s a class.

The solution is to import the class.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?

ITI Basak ITI:

… yes… I read the complier… If you were thinking in a logical matter, You would realize that I wouldn’t be asking questions like this if I knew what it ment and how to fix it… If you wont help, then please leave. All I want to do is learn, I have thought logical and have learned up until a point. I can’t know everything from the start so stop being a jerk please.

I’m not being a jerk. I’m simply trying to make you think for yourself.

Tell me, what does the error mean.

item.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ITI Basak ITI, post:8, topic:394226”]case 12713:
if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(9717,1)){
c.getItems().deleteItem(9717, 1);
Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 2562, 3314, 9373, - 1, -1, 0, 90, 19, 200, 200, true, true);
}
break;

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickObject.java:80: package Server does not ex
ist
Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 2562, 3314
, 9373, - 1, -1, 0, 90, 19, 200, 200, true, true);
^
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

It says what the problem is right there.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?

item.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

really mature… I mean seriously…

It is.

No needed anymore

Sadly, we live in a society where everyone expects to be spoonfed. And if you don’t spoonfeed everyone, you’re called an asshole, jerk, etc. “Thinking” in today’s society is sadly “optional”. And in this community, the majority of people don’t want to think. They want to be told what to do, and if it doesn’t work, it becomes your fault. I am trying to get people to think, because programming is essentially just a group of logical steps, executed in a logical fashion. If people aren’t willing to think in a logical fashion, they won’t make it as a programmer.

Also, you never posted what the error was, or what the compiler said, so nobody could have helped you, because you essentially said “I add code to server, it no work. What do?”

Read full topic

item.title: How Do You Spawn An Npc by Clicking on an Object?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ITI Basak ITI:

lol do you post that on everyones question? Just because we are not all pro coders doesnt mean anything… we all have learn sometime or another… I know the logical steps… Ive been to the clickObject file, created a case with my objects id, said the whole, if player has item, { yada yada yada, but I need the actual spawnNpc Code portion… cause when I place it, I get an error with the spawn Npc code in my compiler

No, what are the logical steps to accomplish this.

For example, the logical steps to make cereal is

  1. Get a bowl
  2. Get some cereal
  3. Get some milk
  4. Pour the cereal into the bowl
  5. Pour some milk into the bowl

If you’re not willing to think in a logical matter, then you will frequently be at the ass-end of many programming jokes.

Read full topic
